briefdescription.para: We try to do I/O with buffers of this size.
How we write out FabArray<FArrayBox>s. These are deprecated, we always use NFiles. For OneFilePerCPU, set NFiles to NProcs.
The type of a char buffer required by [p]setbuf().
A simple character buffer for setbuf() usage.
Name of the FabArray<FArrayBox>.
The VisMF header as read from disk.
We manage the FABs individually.
Persistent streams. These open on demand and should be closed when not needed with CloseAllStreams. ~VisMF also closes them. [filename, pifs].
The number of files to write for a FabArray<FArrayBox>.
- the settable buffer size

Construct by reading in the on-disk VisMF of the specified name. The FABs in the on-disk FabArray are read on demand unless the entire FabArray is requested. The name here is the name of the FabArray not the name of the on-disk files.
The number of components in the on-disk FabArray<FArrayBox>.
The grow factor of the on-disk FabArray<FArrayBox>.

para.heading: of FABs in the VisMF. Equal to # of Boxes in the BoxArray.

briefdescription.para: The BoxArray of the on-disk FabArray<FArrayBox>.
The min of the FAB (in valid region) at specified index and component.
The min of the FabArray (in valid region) at specified component.
The max of the FAB (in valid region) at specified index and component.
The max of the FabArray (in valid region) at specified component.
The FAB at the specified index and component. Reads it from disk if necessary. This reads only the specified component.
Delete()s the FAB at the specified index and component.
Delete()s the FAB at the specified index (all components).
Delete()s all the FABs.
Read the entire fab (all components).
Read the specified fab component.
Open the stream if it is not already open Close the stream if not persistent or forced Close all open streams.

memberdef.argsstring: (const FabArray< FArrayBox > &fafab, const std::string &name, VisMF::How how=NFiles, bool set_ghost=false)
memberdef.name: Write

briefdescription.para: Write a FabArray<FArrayBox> to disk in a "smart" way. Returns the total number of bytes written on this processor. If set_ghost is true, sets the ghost cells in the FabArray<FArrayBox> to one-half the average of the min and max over the valid region of each contained FAB.

memberdef.argsstring: (const FabArray< FArrayBox > &mf, const std::string &mf_name, VisMF::How how=NFiles)
memberdef.name: WriteOnlyHeader

briefdescription.para: Write only the header-file corresponding to FabArray<FArrayBox> to disk without the corresponding FAB data. This writes BoxArray information (which might still be needed by data post-processing tools such as yt) when the FAB data is not needed. Returns the total number of bytes written on this processor.
this will remove nfiles associated with name and the header

memberdef.argsstring: (FabArray< FArrayBox > &fafab, const std::string &name, const char *faHeader=nullptr, int coordinatorProc=ParallelDescriptor::IOProcessorNumber())
memberdef.name: Read

briefdescription.para: Read a FabArray<FArrayBox> from disk written using VisMF::Write(). If the FabArray<FArrayBox> fafab has been fully defined, the BoxArray on the disk must match the BoxArray in fafab. If it is constructed with the default constructor, the BoxArray on the disk will be used and a new DistributionMapping will be made. A pre-read FabArray header can be passed in to avoid a read and broadcast.
Does FabArray exist?
Read only the header of a FabArray, header will be resized here.
Check if the multifab is ok, false is returned if not ok.
The file offset of the passed ostream.

memberdef.argsstring: (const FabArray< FArrayBox > &fafab, const std::string &fafab_name, VisMF::Header &hdr, bool groupSets, VisMF::Header::Version whichVersion, NFilesIter &nfi)
memberdef.name: FindOffsets

briefdescription.para: fileNumbers must be passed in for dynamic set selection [proc]

memberdef.argsstring: (int fabIndex, const std::string &fafab_name, const Header &hdr, int whichComp=-1)
memberdef.name: readFAB

briefdescription.para: Make a new FAB from a fab in a FabArray<FArrayBox> on disk. The returned *FAB will have either one component filled from fafab[fabIndex][whichComp] or fafab[fabIndex].nComp() components. whichComp == -1 means reads the whole FAB. Otherwise read just that component.

memberdef.argsstring: (FabArray< FArrayBox > &fafab, int fabIndex, const std::string &fafab_name, const Header &hdr)
memberdef.name: readFAB

briefdescription.para: Read the whole FAB into fafab[fabIndex].
File I/O for FabArray<FArrayBox>. Wrapper class for reading/writing FabArray<FArrayBox> objects to disk in various "smart" ways.
